newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish refinery to halt production in price dispute.
newsitem.headline: Turkish refinery to halt production in price dispute.

text.p: Turkey's southern Atas refinery, jointly owned by Mobil Corp, Shell, British Petroleum and Turkish Marmara Petrol, will halt production from Wednesday in a pricing dispute with the government, Anatolian news agency said.

Refinery officials said a seven percent petrol price rise, newly allowed by the government, was very low against the increase in world crude prices and continous depreciation of the Turkish lira against the dollar.
The refinery's losses reached $55 million in the first 10 months of this year, they said.
Atas, which has a 14 percent share in Turkish production of petroleum products, had earlier halved its production.
State-owned Tupras refineries raised petrol prices by seven percent late on Monday. -- Ankara newsroom +90-312-446 2940
